content:
About Ogilvy 
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry.
About the Role 
Ogilvy is seeking an experienced Executive Assistant to join our New York office to partner with our senior level executives to deliver operational excellence, communicate with internal and external industry professionals on a global scale, and work with employees at all levels within the agency. We’re looking for an efficient collaborator who is highly organized, able to build relationships, and draws upon the expertise of Ogilvy’s vast resources and capabilities.  This position provides the opportunity to learn about corporate strategy, positioning, and operations from the agency’s most senior leadership. For the right person this can be a huge growth and development opportunity and a steppingstone to a successful career within the world's greatest creative network,
What You’ll Do
Project Management / Coordination

Lead team operations including internal communications, email distribution lists, technology, upgrades, new hire coordination, time keeping assistance, etc.
Assist senior executives and their teams in conducting research, preparing presentations (PowerPoint & Keynote) and reports, and tracking a variety of details
Assist senior executives with calendar management and meeting coordination
Plan and organize travel arrangements (domestic and international) which includes researching and scheduling the best options, dealing with necessary changes/adjustments to the itinerary, and preparing related expense reports via our travel and expense platform Concur
Handle document preparation and create and/or edit using advanced features of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Anticipate upcoming needs, risks, and hurdles, and provide ideas to mitigate any issues that might arise
Collaborate with consulting teams to design presentations and artifacts with quick turnarounds, communicating ideas in visually compelling and potent ways
Manage multiple task lists, seeing tasks through to completion, often under tight deadlines
Lead and complete special projects as required
Assist with coordination of team internal meetings and events, including booking rooms/spaces, ordering and managing catering, and coordinating with in-house facilities
Assist with supply maintenance and orders
Provide backup support to other EAs when they are out of the office

What You’ll Need 

Previous experience in an agency administrative support role to a senior-level leader is a plus
Proven time management and organizational skills and an exceptional ability to pay attention to detail in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment
Must possess strong administration/office skills including business etiquette, answering phones, and fielding requests (ability to act as a “gate keeper”)
Solid experience with presentation design programs such as PowerPoint, Keynote, Google Slides
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (SharePoint, Excel, .oc) as well as MS Outlook for scheduling and communication, preparation of documents, and reports
Extensive experience with calendar management, travel planning (including domestic and international travel), and expense reports
Strong multi-tasking skills and the composure required to display grace under pressure
Proven ability to take initiative and think and plan ahead
Discretion, good judgment, and a high degree of confidentiality
Detail-oriented, collaborative mindset
Ability to balance and prioritize business objectives
Willingness to pitch in wherever necessary with a “no task too big or small” mindset

How We’ll Support You
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We will empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you will be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.

We offer a competitive benefits package, click here for more details.Pay Range$40,000—$70,000 USDAt Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
